title: Use Mean Value Theorem to find slope on a graph

content.question: A portion of the graph of a differentiable function f is shown above. If the value <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>c</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaam4yaiabg2da9iaaiodaaaa@389F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> satisfies the conclusion of the Mean Value Theorem applied to f on the open interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>8</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B64@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, what is the slope of the line tangent to the graph of f at on <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2da9iaaiodaaaa@38B4@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
